alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Custer; Fallon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Carbon; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Southwestern Yellowstone; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 10:04AM MDT until October 25 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation occurring. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM MDT this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 6 PM MDT this evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, are or will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mix of freezing rain or drizzle and snow today will turn to all snow tonight. Snow tonight may be locally heavy at times.
info.instruction: For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying travel tonight through Friday morning due to the potential for heavy snow. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
